text: Hraiv rTel rTHTf sfefasrut Phone 91-11-25074100/250' (8575 Aa67 Jir 7uTT #Ar4) Fax 91-11-25093507/2504 Extn. 2223/2318/2468/ National Highways Authority of India (Ministry of Road Transport & Highways) G-5 & 6, Sector-10, Dwarka, New Delhi-1 10045 NHAI/13013/3/03-04/CMD-CO/Policy on Toll 30 Sept 2003 CIRCUAR NQ:NHAICOMMERCIALOPERATIONBQ It has been observed during the recent past that commencement of fee collection could not be taken up immediately on publication of the fee notification for various reasons. This has resulted into several audit observations pertaining to loss of revenue: It immediate concerted efforts to improve system of advance planning for various activities. While certain activities can only be undertaken after receipt of published fee notification; there are other activities which could be undertaken well in advance, to publication of fee notification. In this regard following instructions are issued for strict compliance All activities, which are lsted in Annexure 'A must be completed prior to publication of the fee notification   preferably within 90 days to the anticipated completion of4-laning of the section bypass: ii) Al such activities   along with time schedule, which are normally to be undertaken after receipt of the published notification, are listed in Annexure 'B' . ii) Normally Corridor Management Division also keeps track of the notification when a fee notification is forwarded to the Government Printing Press from the Ministry of Road Transport & Highways. During this   process, concerned PIU CMU is also kept informed about the forthcoming publication with a copy of the notification submitted to Government Printing Press This information should further enable concerned PIU/CMU to prepone certain activities listed at Sr: No 2, 5a, 5b, Sh, 6,9,10.in Annexure 'B' . iv) However, activities like publication of notification in newspaper listed at Sr: No. 3 & 4 and certain other activities viz Sc, d, e, f, g etc: shall be undertaken only after receipt of published notification, which has unique ST. no. It is further clarified that: List of activities given in Annexure As and B' are merely indicative and may not be exhaustive As such, all activities be listed planned as per local circumstances.
